svg.content: <mxfile userAgent="Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/63.0.3239.84 Safari/537.36" version="7.8.6" editor="www.draw.io" type="github"><diagram name="Page-1" id="90a13364-a465-7bf4-72fc-28e22215d7a0"></diagram></mxfile>

g.text: This is a mockable API class.
— Its role is to define all method/property signatures for the compiler and the intellisense.
— It's implementation can be completely overridden.
— Its job is to delegate all method calls to the real implementation, nothing else.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 208px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div:
Red background — system properties.
They are not intended for the end-user.

switch.text:
Red background — system properties.
They are not intended for the end-user.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 236px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div: Yellow background — API properties and methods. They are here for the end-user.

switch.text: Yellow background — API properties and methods. They are here for the end-user.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 182px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div:
Normal text — instance properties
and methods.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 236px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

div.b: Bold text — static properties and methods.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 52px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

g.text: — Its role is to provide implementation for all static methods and constructors.
— It has to be public, and all his methods and properties should be public
— All its methods and properties are non-static (!).
This object is stored in the static Implementation property of the Signature class.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 148px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div: Constructor methods create and return the Self class

switch.text: Constructor methods create and return the Self class

g.text: — Its role is to provide implementation for all instance methods and constructors.
— It has to be public, and all his methods and properties should be public
— All its methods and properties are non-static.
This object is stored in the Self property of the Signature class

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 236px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div: Green background — implementation classes (or mocking classes).

switch.text: Green background — implementation classes (or mocking classes).

g.text: Mocking classes are just alternative implementation classes.
They have the same structure and responsibilities.
— Implementation class — implements static methods and constructors
— Self (instance class) — implements instance methods and constructors
To mock an API class, you replace its implementation like this:
